intro: Alpinia pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth and tall, branched stems that bear narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the showy, fragrant inflorescence with pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. Alpinia pubiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
